plugin.name: Apache Maven Compiler Plugin
plugin.description: The Compiler Plugin is used to compile the sources of your project.

parameter.name: annotationProcessorPaths
parameter.description:
Classpath elements to supply as annotation processor path. If specified, the compiler will detect annotation processors only in those classpath elements. If omitted, the default classpath is used to detect annotation processors. The detection itself depends on the configuration of annotationProcessors.
Each classpath element is specified using their Maven coordinates (groupId, artifactId, version, classifier, type). Transitive dependencies are added automatically. Example:
<configuration> <annotationProcessorPaths> <path> <groupId>org.sample</groupId> <artifactId>sample-annotation-processor</artifactId> <version>1.2.3</version> </path> <!-- ... more ... --> </annotationProcessorPaths> </configuration>

parameter.name: annotationProcessors
parameter.description: Names of annotation processors to run. Only applies to JDK 1.6+ If not set, the default annotation processors discovery process applies.

parameter.name: compilerArgs
parameter.description:
Sets the arguments to be passed to the compiler if fork is set to true. Example:
<compilerArgs> <arg>-Xmaxerrs=1000</arg> <arg>-Xlint</arg> <arg>-J-Duser.language=en_us</arg> </compilerArgs>

parameter.name: compilerArgument
parameter.description:
Sets the unformatted single argument string to be passed to the compiler if fork is set to true. To pass multiple arguments such as -Xmaxerrs 1000 (which are actually two arguments) you have to use compilerArguments.
This is because the list of valid arguments passed to a Java compiler varies based on the compiler version.

parameter.name: compilerArguments
parameter.description:
Sets the arguments to be passed to the compiler (prepending a dash) if fork is set to true.
This is because the list of valid arguments passed to a Java compiler varies based on the compiler version.
To pass -Xmaxerrs 1000 -Xlint -Xlint:-path -Averbose=true you should include the following:
<compilerArguments> <Xmaxerrs>1000</Xmaxerrs> <Xlint/> <Xlint:-path/> <Averbose>true</Averbose> </compilerArguments>

parameter.name: compilerId
parameter.description: The compiler id of the compiler to use. See this guide for more information.

parameter.name: compilerReuseStrategy
parameter.description: Strategy to re use javacc class created: - reuseCreated (default): will reuse already created but in case of multi-threaded builds, each thread will have its own instance - reuseSame: the same Javacc class will be used for each compilation even for multi-threaded build - alwaysNew: a new Javacc class will be created for each compilation Note this parameter value depends on the os/jdk you are using, but the default value should work on most of env.

parameter.name: compilerVersion
parameter.description: Version of the compiler to use, ex. '1.3', '1.5', if fork is set to true.

parameter.name: debug
parameter.description: Set to true to include debugging information in the compiled class files.

parameter.name: debuglevel
parameter.description: Keyword list to be appended to the -g command-line switch. Legal values are none or a comma-separated list of the following keywords: lines, vars, and source. If debug level is not specified, by default, nothing will be appended to -g. If debug is not turned on, this attribute will be ignored.

parameter.name: encoding
parameter.description: The -encoding argument for the Java compiler.

parameter.name: excludes
parameter.description: A list of exclusion filters for the compiler.

parameter.name: executable
parameter.description: Sets the executable of the compiler to use when fork is true.

parameter.name: failOnError
parameter.description: Indicates whether the build will continue even if there are compilation errors.

parameter.name: failOnWarning
parameter.description: Indicates whether the build will continue even if there are compilation warnings.

parameter.name: fileExtensions
parameter.description: file extensions to check timestamp for incremental build default contains only .class

parameter.name: forceJavacCompilerUse
parameter.description: compiler can now use javax.tools if available in your current jdk, you can disable this feature using -Dmaven.compiler.forceJavacCompilerUse=true or in the plugin configuration

parameter.name: fork
parameter.description: Allows running the compiler in a separate process. If false it uses the built in compiler, while if true it will use an executable.

parameter.name: generatedSourcesDirectory
parameter.description: Specify where to place generated source files created by annotation processing. Only applies to JDK 1.6+

parameter.name: includes
parameter.description: A list of inclusion filters for the compiler.

parameter.name: jdkToolchain
parameter.description: Specify the requirements for this jdk toolchain. This overrules the toolchain selected by the maven-toolchain-plugin. note: requires at least Maven 3.3.1

parameter.name: maxmem
parameter.description: Sets the maximum size, in megabytes, of the memory allocation pool, ex. '128', '128m' if fork is set to true.

parameter.name: meminitial
parameter.description: Initial size, in megabytes, of the memory allocation pool, ex. '64', '64m' if fork is set to true.

parameter.name: optimize
parameter.description: Set to true to optimize the compiled code using the compiler's optimization methods.

parameter.name: outputFileName
parameter.description: Sets the name of the output file when compiling a set of sources to a single file. expression='${project.build.finalName}'

parameter.name: parameters
parameter.description: Set to true to generate metadata for reflection on method parameters.

parameter.name: proc
parameter.description:
Sets whether annotation processing is performed or not. Only applies to JDK 1.6+ If not set, both compilation and annotation processing are performed at the same time.
Allowed values are:
- none - no annotation processing is performed. - only - only annotation processing is done, no compilation.

parameter.name: release
parameter.description: The -release argument for the Java compiler, supported since Java9

parameter.name: showDeprecation
parameter.description: Sets whether to show source locations where deprecated APIs are used.

parameter.name: showWarnings
parameter.description: Set to true to show compilation warnings.

parameter.name: skipMain
parameter.description: Set this to 'true' to bypass compilation of main sources. Its use is NOT RECOMMENDED, but quite convenient on occasion.

parameter.name: source
parameter.description: The -source argument for the Java compiler.

parameter.name: staleMillis
parameter.description: Sets the granularity in milliseconds of the last modification date for testing whether a source needs recompilation.

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The -target argument for the Java compiler.

parameter.name: useIncrementalCompilation
parameter.description: to enable/disable incrementation compilation feature

parameter.name: verbose
parameter.description: Set to true to show messages about what the compiler is doing.

mojo.description: Display help information on maven-compiler-plugin. Call mvn compiler:help -Ddetail=true -Dgoal=<goal-name> to display parameter details.

parameter.name: detail
parameter.description: If true, display all settable properties for each goal.

parameter.name: goal
parameter.description: The name of the goal for which to show help. If unspecified, all goals will be displayed.

parameter.name: indentSize
parameter.description: The number of spaces per indentation level, should be positive.

parameter.name: lineLength
parameter.description: The maximum length of a display line, should be positive.

parameter.name: annotationProcessorPaths
parameter.description:
Classpath elements to supply as annotation processor path. If specified, the compiler will detect annotation processors only in those classpath elements. If omitted, the default classpath is used to detect annotation processors. The detection itself depends on the configuration of annotationProcessors.
Each classpath element is specified using their Maven coordinates (groupId, artifactId, version, classifier, type). Transitive dependencies are added automatically. Example:
<configuration> <annotationProcessorPaths> <path> <groupId>org.sample</groupId> <artifactId>sample-annotation-processor</artifactId> <version>1.2.3</version> </path> <!-- ... more ... --> </annotationProcessorPaths> </configuration>

parameter.name: annotationProcessors
parameter.description: Names of annotation processors to run. Only applies to JDK 1.6+ If not set, the default annotation processors discovery process applies.

This is because the list of valid arguments passed to a Java compiler varies based on the compiler version.

parameter.name: compilerArguments

Sets the arguments to be passed to the compiler (prepending a dash) if fork is set to true.
This is because the list of valid arguments passed to a Java compiler varies based on the compiler version.
To pass -Xmaxerrs 1000 -Xlint -Xlint:-path -Averbose=true you should include the following:

parameter.name: generatedTestSourcesDirectory
parameter.description: Specify where to place generated source files created by annotation processing. Only applies to JDK 1.6+

parameter.name: jdkToolchain
parameter.description: Specify the requirements for this jdk toolchain. This overrules the toolchain selected by the maven-toolchain-plugin. note: requires at least Maven 3.3.1

Sets whether annotation processing is performed or not. Only applies to JDK 1.6+ If not set, both compilation and annotation processing are performed at the same time.
Allowed values are:
- none - no annotation processing is performed. - only - only annotation processing is done, no compilation.

parameter.name: release
parameter.description: The -release argument for the Java compiler, supported since Java9

parameter.name: showDeprecation
parameter.description: Sets whether to show source locations where deprecated APIs are used.

parameter.name: showWarnings
parameter.description: Set to true to show compilation warnings.

parameter.name: skip
parameter.description: Set this to 'true' to bypass compilation of test sources. Its use is NOT RECOMMENDED, but quite convenient on occasion.

parameter.name: source
parameter.description: The -source argument for the Java compiler.

parameter.name: staleMillis
parameter.description: Sets the granularity in milliseconds of the last modification date for testing whether a source needs recompilation.

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The -target argument for the Java compiler.

parameter.name: testCompilerArgument
parameter.description:
Sets the unformatted argument string to be passed to test compiler if fork is set to true.
This is because the list of valid arguments passed to a Java compiler varies based on the compiler version.

parameter.name: testCompilerArguments
parameter.description:
Sets the arguments to be passed to test compiler (prepending a dash) if fork is set to true.
This is because the list of valid arguments passed to a Java compiler varies based on the compiler version.

parameter.name: testExcludes
parameter.description: A list of exclusion filters for the compiler.

parameter.name: testIncludes
parameter.description: A list of inclusion filters for the compiler.

parameter.name: testRelease
parameter.description: the -release argument for the test Java compiler

parameter.name: testSource
parameter.description: The -source argument for the test Java compiler.

parameter.name: testTarget
parameter.description: The -target argument for the test Java compiler.

parameter.name: useIncrementalCompilation
parameter.description: to enable/disable incrementation compilation feature

parameter.name: verbose
parameter.description: Set to true to show messages about what the compiler is doing.
